intro: Cousinia afghanica, commonly known as Afghan globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its globular inflorescence, which consists of numerous small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Cousinia afghanica is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
